p: Seventy plants used by the traditional practitioners for the treatment of skin, wounds, and other infections were documented from the survey (Supplementary Material- Table S1). The plants were distributed across 63 genera belonging to 31 families, mostly Fabaceae (9), Euphorbiaceae (6), Moraceae (6), and Meliaceae (6). The vernacular names of plants, uses, methods of preparation, and the administration of remedies were documented.
